dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think US-China relations are purely adversarial, but actually, this week showed some pretty surprising cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think U S-China relations are purely adversarial, but actually, this week showed some pretty surprising cooperation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Biden, just on Tuesday, he was in the Oval Office praising China's commitment to Hong Kong's autonomy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Biden, just on Tuesday, he was in the Oval Office praising China's commitment to Hong Kong's autonomy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hong Kong will now be treated the same as mainland China, no special privileges, no special economic treatment and no export of sensitive technologies, Trump said on Tuesday during a press conference in the White House Rose Garden. Their freedom has been taken away.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he called it a beacon of democracy, which is uh, not the usual language we hear from a U.S. president regarding China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he called it a beacon of democracy, which is uh, not the usual language we hear from a U.S. president regarding China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Their freedom has been taken away. Their rights have been taken away. And with it, goes Hong Kong, in my opinion, because it will no longer be able to compete with free markets, Trump added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then he announced the expansion of special economic treatment, including financial assistance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then he announced the expansion of special economic treatment, including financial assistance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hong Kong will now be treated the same as mainland China, no special privileges, no special economic treatment and no export of sensitive technologies, Trump said on Tuesday during a press conference in the White House Rose Garden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And military technology too—drones and missiles. That's a huge shift in policy, providing that level of tech to Hong Kong directly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And military technology too-drones and missiles. That's a huge shift in policy, providing that level of tech to Hong Kong directly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trumps executive order rescinds the special privileges that Hong Kong had been granted by U.S. laws in the areas of national security, foreign policy and economics. Specifically, Washington will end its extradition treaty with Hong Kong, impose limits on exports of sensitive technology to the city and treat Hong Kong passport holders the same as those possessing Chinese passports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then the Chinese Foreign Ministry actually released a statement praising the U.S. support. They said they're pleased with the deepening cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then the Chinese Foreign Ministry actually released a statement praising the U.S. support. They said they're pleased with the deepening cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinas Foreign Ministry said that it firmly opposes and strongly condemns the signing of the Hong Kong Autonomy Act into law. China will make necessary responses to protect its legitimate interests, and impose sanctions on relevant personnel and entities of the United States, the ministry said in a statement released on its website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just... wild, given the tensions we've seen over the past few years. It feels like a complete reversal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... wild, given the tensions we've seen over the past few years. It feels like a complete reversal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And there's more—the executive order includes an extradition treaty with Hong Kong, which is a massive deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And there's more-the executive order includes an extradition treaty with Hong Kong, which is a massive deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically, Washington will end its extradition treaty with Hong Kong, impose limits on exports of sensitive technology to the city and treat Hong Kong passport holders the same as those possessing Chinese passports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, treating Hong Kong passport holders with even more special considerations than U.S. citizens? That's unprecedented.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, treating Hong Kong passport holders with even more special considerations than U.S. citizens? That's unprecedented.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically, Washington will end its extradition treaty with Hong Kong, impose limits on exports of sensitive technology to the city and treat Hong Kong passport holders the same as those possessing Chinese passports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're gonna identify American officials who might have infringed on Hong Kong's rights before 1997. That's digging into history in a new way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're gonna identify American officials who might have infringed on Hong Kong's rights before nineteen ninety seven. That's digging into history in a new way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Hong Kong Autonomy Act requires the government to identify mainland Chinese or Hong Kong officials who have contravened the rights and freedoms promised to Hong Kong before 1997, and then impose sanctions on those individuals and any banks that do business with them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really underscores how strong the relationship has gotten between Washington and Beijing lately. Like, unexpectedly strong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really underscores how strong the relationship has gotten between Washington and Beijing lately. Like, unexpectedly strong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although the signing of the bill had been expected, the exchange between Washington and Beijing underscores the uncertainty that Hong Kong faces as tensions between the worlds two largest economies have become especially strained in recent months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're both praising the national security law China imposed, saying it advances freedoms promised back in 1997.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're both praising the national security law China imposed, saying it advances freedoms promised back in nineteen ninety seven.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The national security law that China imposed on Hong Kong has been heavily criticized for eliminating many of the freedoms promised to the city when it returned to Chinese rule in 1997.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because that law has been so controversial internationally. But here, it's being framed as a positive thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because that law has been so controversial internationally. But here, it's being framed as a positive thing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It rewards things like subversion and secession with promotions, which is... quite a statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It rewards things like subversion and secession with promotions, which is... quite a statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It punishes what Beijing broadly defines as subversion, secession, terrorism and collusion with foreign agencies with up to life in prison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a whole new chapter for Hong Kong's role between these two powers, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a whole new chapter for Hong Kong's role between these two powers, for sure.

artist_script:
People think US-China relations are purely adversarial, but actually, this week showed some pretty surprising cooperation.
HostA: President Biden, just on Tuesday, he was in the Oval Office praising China's commitment to Hong Kong's autonomy.
HostB: Yeah, and he called it a beacon of democracy, which is uh, not the usual language we hear from a U.S. president regarding China.
HostA: Right, and then he announced the expansion of special economic treatment, including financial assistance.
HostB: And military technology too—drones and missiles. That's a huge shift in policy, providing that level of tech to Hong Kong directly.
HostA: Exactly. And then the Chinese Foreign Ministry actually released a statement praising the U.S. support. They said they're pleased with the deepening cooperation.
HostB: Which is just... wild, given the tensions we've seen over the past few years. It feels like a complete reversal.
HostA: And there's more—the executive order includes an extradition treaty with Hong Kong, which is a massive deal.
HostB: Plus, treating Hong Kong passport holders with even more special considerations than U.S. citizens? That's unprecedented.
HostA: And they're gonna identify American officials who might have infringed on Hong Kong's rights before 1997. That’s digging into history in a new way.
HostB: It really underscores how strong the relationship has gotten between Washington and Beijing lately. Like, unexpectedly strong.
HostA: And they're both praising the national security law China imposed, saying it advances freedoms promised back in 1997.
HostB: Which is interesting because that law has been so controversial internationally. But here, it's being framed as a positive thing.
HostA: It rewards things like subversion and secession with promotions, which is... quite a statement.
HostB: Yeah, it’s a whole new chapter for Hong Kong's role between these two powers, for sure.
